Configuring ASMail test account.

Sign in

With ASMail protocol, any server, located at any domain may service users with any address. For example, server mail.provider.net may be set in DNS record of perfect.com as providing ASMail service for all addresses @perfect.com. At the same time, some users@perfect.com may tell some of their correspondents to use server located at a totally different domain, paranoidly.secure.net. In this later case, users@perfect.com would have to set accounts for themselves at paranoidly.secure.net. This may be done by signin with passwords, or using Public Key Login, both of which require users@perfect.com to use yet another set of passwords/keys. To mitigate this issue without compromising privacy, login into paranoidly.secure.net can be done via MailerId protocol, which, due to its non-tracking properties, will not leak to identity provider for perfect.com that some of its users are using paranoidly.secure.net.

This ASMail test service is using MailerId process to sign in for viewing and configuring accounts. Follow process steps in process log below, and in a network activity inspector of your browser.
